episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including the frequent changes in Australian Prime Ministers, a mishap at a Titanic Museum, the unexpected items left on the moon by Apollo missions, and the peculiarities of the deer pizzle market in New Zealand.

facts.fact: In 2015, paramedics in Australia stopped asking patients to name the Prime Minister as a test of mental capacity because the answer changes so often, it's no longer considered a reliable indicator.
Three people were recently hospitalized after being hit by an iceberg at a Titanic Museum.
There are nine hammocks on the moon.
Deer penises are often sold with the pelvis attached, so the buyer knows they're not being ripped off with a seal's penis.
